Posts.Content: Yes please do. The pathology report came back yesterday, I have triple negative grade 3. Treatment planning tomorrow eeeeek!xx
Posts.Title: Found a lump. Sick with worry!

Posts.Content: Thank you for the kind words and reassurance. I think it’s really hit home today. I went to the GP fully expecting her to roll her eyes at me and tell me it was something normal due to breastfeeding and send me on my way again. I didn’t even tell my partner I’d found a lump never mind going to the docs about it. I wasn’t expecting to be referred to be seen within 2 weeks, and certainly wasn’t expecting a phone call from the clinic to book me in 4hrs after leaving the GP.xx
Posts.Title: Found a lump. Sick with worry!

Posts.Content: Thank you honey and lemon and mistymoley. Moomy, I’m so sorry you are going through this. It sounds like you have had way more than your fair share to deal with already. I’m glad your daughter is in remission and hopefully her immune system will build up over time? It must be unbelievably worrying for you though, and caring for 2 people means you barely have time to even think about yourself. I hope you can find some time to look after yourself too. So do you not receive biopsy results there and then at the appointment? I was assuming it would be all results from all tests. Sending hugs to you too xx
Posts.Title: Found a lump. Sick with worry!

Posts.Content: Thank you both. Xxx I feel unusually calm since being told (burst into tears for a brief couple seconds when the consultant asked what is the first thing I think about when told you have cancer but that’s it), is this calm normal? Xxx
Posts.Title: Found a lump. Sick with worry!

Posts.Content: Hi Motherofdogs, I’m sorry you are going through this horrible fear of the unknown waiting period too. Have you got an appointment booked or waiting for a date?  With a nearly 7 month old and a 3.5yr old I’ve got plenty to keep me busy, but even that is not enough to fully keep my mind off it. This morning I’ve been to the supermarket, driving home I was sat at the front of a queue at red traffic lights, the lights turned green and I still sat there for god knows how long before I was snapped back to reality by beeping horns. Have you been able to feel the lump now your doc has found it?xx
Posts.Title: Found a lump. Sick with worry!

Posts.Content: Aww he sounds lovely Yes,  I had to make a bit of an embarrassing call to the taxi firm.  “Hi, bit of an unusual one, but I don’t suppose anyone has handed in a breast pump?” *a little chuckle to himself* “no, I’m sorry love. To be honest, I don’t reckon half the blokes would even know what a breast pump was if they came across one” I know what you mean about coping better on your own, I feel the same way. I was planning on going by myself and not telling anyone until if/when. But in my drunken stupor I told my partner so now he wants to be with me. Have you told anyone? Xx
Posts.Title: Found a lump. Sick with worry!

Posts.Content: I think that’s the problem, I think until it’s you that is going through it, you have absolutely no idea of how worrying it actually is. Or at least for me, I think if someone told me they had found a lump or other symptom, before this, I’d probably have been thinking “oh I’m sure it’s nothing serious, most lumps etc turn out not to be cancerous” It’s easy to think positively and be dismissive when it’s not you. Xx
Posts.Title: Found a lump. Sick with worry!

Posts.Content: Hi, I feel kind of wrong posting on here as I have a lump but haven’t had it investigated yet. I just don’t know who else to talk to.  I saw my GP on Thursday and she has referred me to the breast clinic. My appointment isn’t until this Thursday, and think I will be out my mind with worry before then, each day the possible outcome seems to sink in a bit more. I have a baby and a preschooler and I’m so so scared for their future if the outcome is bad for me.xx
Posts.Title: Found a lump. Sick with worry!

Posts.Content: I’m so sorry to be so selfish posting before I’ve even had any diagnosis. My head is just spinning  at a million miles an hour xx
Posts.Title: Found a lump. Sick with worry!

Posts.Content: Ahh I’m glad you’ve got your dog to help you through, what breed is he/she? Dogs are always happy to see you and seem to know when you just need that snuggle. Luckily my little boy goes to nursery on the day I have my appointment. I was debating whether to try find someone to look after the baby while at the appointment as it’s a one stop clinic so I think all tests and results in one day, so there for a few hrs.  BUT (bit of an embarrassing story here...) I’m breastfeeding at the mo. I was planning on taking my breast pump so I could empty them before the tests rather than have milk squirting all over. We had a very rare night out on Saturday, I got VERY VERY drunk, I lost my pump out my bag. So I’m going to have to take her along to drain me, haha! I hope your appointment is soon and you’re not left waiting another week between. I suppose I’m quite lucky I only had/have a week between seeing GP and the clinic appt, even that feels like a lifetime, but on the other hand getting a call a few hrs after leaving the GP surgery has made me even more worried that it’s not good. I was convinced the doc would tell me it wasn’t anything to be worried about.xx
Posts.Title: Found a lump. Sick with worry!

Posts.Content: So just a little update.  I had my appointment at the breast clinic today. They can’t cant tell me they are 100% sure until my biopsy results come back........but they have told me it is “highly highly HIGHLY likely” I have breast cancer, so basically I do but they need it on paper. They have told me I’m looking at a lumpectomy for the 2.5-3cm lump and definitely radiotherapy if it’s only a lumpectomy, and more than likely chemo due to me being ‘young’ (36), but need my biopsy results to see what type of cancer they are dealing with before they can create the treatment plan. We’ve also been asked to seriously think about if we have completed our family (with our 3.5yr old and 7month old) and they need to know ASAP as I will be referred to another hospital (I’m assuming for egg harvesting??) if not. Wow, my mind is blown!
Posts.Title: Found a lump. Sick with worry!

Posts.Content: Thank you Motherofdogs. I will have everything, fingers toes everything, crossed for you for 28th, I feel for you that you’re still in that waiting limbo. Xx
Posts.Title: Found a lump. Sick with worry!

Posts.Content: I have my fingers crossed for you today Motherofdogs. Good luck. Xxx
Posts.Title: Found a lump. Sick with worry!

Posts.Content: Ahh thank you so much for the support, that really is so kind of you. But honestly, please don’t stay on here just for my benefit, you are free! Run as fast as you can, but just keep checking yourself, hopefully you’ll never have to check back in So happy for you and thank you again xxx
Posts.Title: Found a lump. Sick with worry!
